pr_title: Use Pooled Byte Arrays in BlobStoreRepository Serialization

timeline.message:
Use Pooled Byte Arrays in BlobStoreRepository Serialization

Many of the metadata blobs we handle in the changed spots can grow
up in size up to `O(1M)`. Not using recycled bytes when working with
them causes significant spikes in memory use for larger repositories.

timeline.bodyText: It's not exclusively laziness that I didn't make this path use pooled bytes now as well. Caching here turned out to be somewhat bogus in practice and needs to be changed (will do over the next few days when I find some time). I just went with the simplest possible change here for now as it doesn't really matter.
timeline.author: original-brownbear

timeline.bodyText:
Creating the serialized repo data to cache here early is a win even without pooled buffers for the serialization. It wasn't necessary to keep the uncompressed version around for the duration of the below cluster state update.
This is especially true when it turns out to be very large (as in multiple MB or so) and won't be cached to begin with.
